alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Grant (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 24 at 4:32PM CDT until October 24 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern Oklahoma, including the following counties, Garfield, Grant, Kay and Noble. * WHEN...Until 545 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 432 PM CDT, doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.4 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ponca City, Blackwell, Tonkawa, Newkirk, Garber, Covington, Billings, Marland, Fairmont, Kildare, Douglas, northwestern Kaw Lake, Bison, Ceres, Hayward and Peckham. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
